solution_line_template: If half the value of what Connie sold the land for was ${money_given_to_blake}, then the full value was ${money_given_to_blake}*{share_divisor} = $<<{money_given_to_blake}*{share_divisor}={full_sale_value}>>{full_sale_value}.

If ${full_sale_value} is triple what Connie bought the land for, then the initial cost, which is the amount given to her by Blake, was ${full_sale_value}/{value_multiplier} = $<<{full_sale_value}/{value_multiplier}={initial_cost}>>{initial_cost}.
